Articles.Content: I cant find Persistence.sfs ANYWHERE in my Kerbal Space Program Folder (Were i installed it which is C:\Program Files (x86)\Kerbal Space Program) I REALLY want to delete it as before i started Kerbal i knew NOTHING of Space Debris and how Ugly and annoying it is
It's under saves/default, and it's persistent.sfs. I can never remember where it is, though, so I just search the folder for the truncated form "persis" and it finds it for me.

H:\Program Files (x86)\Kerbal space program\KSP 16\saves\default

Thats where it is on mine. Just start from ksp16, and go to the saves file, then default.
If you don't see persistent.sfs in your saves/default folder, running the game will create it.
I Ran the game an have it running now and I still dont see a KSP 16 folder.

atually, the KSP 16 folder is my own creation, everything else is not. You paid for the game, right? Or do you just have demo?

IF you have the demo, you dont have a saves folder.

If you do, then there will be a folder called saves
I bought the game, and don't have a saves folder i tried making a save folder once to see if that would work but it didnt

Oops. Just noticed in the original post that you have the game in the Windows "program files" folder, which can cause weirdnesses. Create a new folder, call it whatever you want, and move the game there. I don't know if that will make persistent easier to find, but it will avoid problems with ship design saves and stuff. If you still have trouble, use the search under Windows start and tell it to look for persis*, or something like that.

Are you sure? Because there has to be a folder called saves in side the KSP folder. The only other way is if its the free demo, that dosent have persistance.

EDIT@Vanamonde: I have mine there, and it works fine for me. Mind you that I changed the security settings on the KSP 16 folder to allow full access...

Edited August 25, 2012 by NIN3

Oops. Just noticed in the original post that you have the game in the Windows "program files" folder, which can cause weirdnesses. Create a new folder, call it whatever you want, and move the game there. I don't know if that will make persistent easier to find, but it will avoid problems with ship design saves and stuff. If you still have trouble, use the search under Windows start and tell it to look for persis*, or something like that.

This has Fixed it! Thank you EVERYONE for your help! Also youll be happy to know that if you've made a mod I've probably Downloaded it.
Thank Captain Skunky. He's the one who gave me that tip when I was having problems.

Thank you Vandemonde, i searched hours and hours for this solution and i could not find it!

Oops. Just noticed in the original post that you have the game in the Windows "program files" folder, which can cause weirdnesses. Create a new folder, call it whatever you want, and move the game there. I don't know if that will make persistent easier to find, but it will avoid problems with ship design saves and stuff. If you still have trouble, use the search under Windows start and tell it to look for persis*, or something like that.
